Unlock your future with the Singapore Institute of Technology’s Early Admissions Exercise! Get a head start on your university journey by immersing yourself in a engagement process that will allow you to connect with our dedicated faculty and become part of the SIT community even before your classes begin.

With exciting scholarship opportunities, don’t miss out on the chance to stand out from the crowd and take the first step towards a successful and fulfilling academic journey. Apply now and get ahead of the rest!

Beyond good grades, our ideal applicants are those who have demonstrated outstanding achievements, such as doing well in competitions, showcasing a flair for applied learning, and exhibiting a deep passion for their chosen field of study.
We also value non-academic merits, including strong participation in CCAs and active community involvement.
You will receive an acknowledgement of submission.
Shortlisted applicants are required to attend an engagement session such as workshop, bootcamps.
Outcome will be released within a month from the engagement session.

Got questions about SIT’s Early Admissions Exercise? Here are some frequently asked questions to help you navigate the process. You can also get in touch with our Admissions and Financial Aid Division – they'll be happy to answer any of your questions.
What is the timeline for the Early Admissions Exercise (EAE)?

You may submit your application under the Early Admissions Exercise (EAE) from mid-November. Eligible applicants will be contacted in January. You should receive the outcome of your application by early February.
Do I select all 5 choices in my application?
Yes, you are strongly encouraged to take full advantage of your application by selecting up to five choices. The order of your choices is taken into consideration in our selection process.
How do I know if I have submitted my application successfully?
If your admissions application is successful, you will receive an email notification from us. If you have not heard from us by mid-February, please email us at
Can I submit another application in the main admissions cycle if I am not offered a place in the Early Admissions Exercise?

You do not need to submit another application. Your application will be re-assessed with the rest of the applications during the main application window if you do not receive an offer from us during EAE.
Can I appeal if I have yet to be offered a place in the Early Admissions Exercise?

Successful applicants will hear from us via email in January or February. We will re-assess your application together with the rest of the applications in the main application window, and the outcome will be released from mid-April.
Can I change my programme choices after submitting an Early Admissions Exercise application?
During the EAE application window, you cannot change your programme choices upon submitting your application.
Even so, if you are not successful in your EAE application and wish to change your programme choices during the main application window (Jan-March), you may write to
to request for a change in programme choices before the closing of the Joint Admissions Exercise.

Your application for your revised choices will be subject to fresh competition alongside other applicants applying in the main application window. Only those who are shortlisted will be invited for an assessment.
I received an offer letter from SIT about my Early Admissions Exercise application. Can I request a change in programme?
Yes, you can submit an appeal during the online appeal period (around end-May) or email us at
. We will process your request for change in programme, subject to the university’s consideration and the number of vacancies available in the programme of your appeal choice.
If I receive an offer from SIT, can I still apply to another university during the main application period after the release of polytechnic final semester GPA results?
Your participation in SIT’s EAE does not exclude you from applying to other universities.
